greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of powerful divisors d (excluding 1) of n.
comment: a(n) = sum of divisors d of n from set A001694(m) - powerful numbers for m >=2.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: a(1) = 0, a(p) = 0, a(pq) = 0, a(pq...z) = 0, a(p^k) = ((p^(k+1)-1) / (p-1))-p-1, for p, q = primes, k = natural numbers, pq...z = product of k (k > 2) distinct primes p, q, ..., z.
example: For n = 12, set of such divisors is {4}; a(12) = 4.
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Dec 25 2010
